attributes.comment:
Gentlemen: I believe that the proposal to raise the ICE fee schedule sixty-six
percent on the average is unconscionable. Admission to the United States should
be based on individual merit, not the ability to pay high fees. These fees are out of
reach of a large percentage of the world's population. We already have plenty of
rich people who pay less than their fair share--it is by and large the poor
immigrants who have the motivation to do the hard work our country needs. I work
with these people every week teaching English and I know their precarious
financial conditions first hand. We benefit from their intelligence, ambition, and
work ethic already, without having to hold citizenship in our country for ransom.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Malcolm H. Kenyon
